item.title: Commonplace launches Summer 2021 series on The Business of Knowing
item.dc:creator: Knowledge Futures Group

item.title: Knowledge Futures partners with open science organizations on Docmaps — the foundation for a distributed peer review ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Knowledge Futures Group

item.title: C4DISC and PubPub Release Antiracism Toolkit for Organizations
item.dc:creator: PubPub Team

item.title: Three PubPub Communities Acknowledged by 2021 PROSE Awards
item.description: Design Justice and HDSR secure PROSE wins, and Data Feminism was honored as a finalist by the Association of American Publisher's prestigious 2021 PROSE awards. All are published on PubPub by the MIT Press.
item.dc:creator: PubPub Team

item.title: Knowledge Futures, ASAPbio, and TU Graz to develop Doc Maps: a community-endorsed framework for editorial research events
item.description: The output of the project will include a specification for representing editorial events as Doc Maps, implementation guides for publishers and technology providers, and a roadmap for future development of a Doc Maps ecosystem, including aggregation and discovery services.
dc:creator: Gabriel Stein
Jessica Polka
Tony Ross-Hellauer

item.title: Knowledge Futures Group Annual Report, 2020
item.description: The past year has brought an enormous amount of change and growth to the KFG. This report will provide a more complete picture of where we are and where we’re going.
item.dc:creator: Knowledge Futures Group

item.title: KFG Announces Four New Programs
item.description: As an invitation to potential partners, this announcement outlines plans for inaugural KFG programs to address critical knowledge challenges
item.dc:creator: Knowledge Futures Group

item.title: Knowledge Futures Group and AfricArXiv launch audio/visual preprint repository on PubPub
item.description: "Launching audio/visual preprints takes scholarly communication to the next level - giving scientists the multimedia platform to express their expertise not only in text but truly engaging with other researchers."

item.title: In Response to the OSTP Request for Information
item.dc:creator: Knowledge Futures Group

item.title: PubPub and the American Astronomical Society Launch Revitalized Bulletin of the AAS in New Partnership
item.description: "The AAS has been at the forefront of publishing innovation for many years as one of the first societies to host its flagship research journals online. 'The new community on PubPub  represents a continuation of that tradition,' notes AAS Innovation Scientist Peter K. G. Williams"
item.dc:creator: PubPub Team

item.title: PubPub and the American Psychological Association Announce APA Open for OA Journals
item.description: "The new platform will empower authors to move beyond traditional, static article design by incorporating multimedia features, interactive tables and graphs, and easy sharing options for their research."
